New Records: DeMar DeRozan scored 30 points on 12-of-26 shooting
Key Match Events: The game was tied at 102 at the end of regulation and at 112 after the first overtime.
DeRozan took over after that with a 3-pointer and a trio of step-back jumpers that stunned Miami and left the Heat winless in three overtime games on the road this season.
With his team clinging to a one-point lead in the first overtime, Jaquez missed a pair of free throws with 3 seconds left
Pre-Game Insights: Kings: Sacramento is playing with a lot more heart and effort under Christie than it did the final two weeks under former coach Mike Brown.
Post-Match Reflections: Heat: Coach Erik Spoelstraâ€™s team played solid for the first four quarters but got sloppy in overtime.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Heat are 4-7 without Jimmy Butler this season.
The game was a double overtime game.
Up next, Heat: Face the Golden State Warriors on Tuesday.
Kings: Begin a four-game trip against the Boston Celtics on Friday.
Others: Jaime Jaquez Jr. had a triple-double with 16 points, 12 rebounds and 10 assists for Miami.
Tyler Herro scored 26 but was called for a costly 8-second violation toward the end of the fourth quarter.
Terry Rozier added 18 points, and Haywood Highsmith had 14.
